author: Special Correspondent
text:
BJP general secretary P. Muralidhar Rao on Wednesday said it was up to DMDK leader Vijayakant to make an alliance between the two parties work.

Addressing reporters, Mr. Rao said the BJP had not declared a chief ministerial candidate and this issue was not an “impediment” indicating that the party would be open to accepting Mr. Vijayakant as the leader of the alliance.

“From our side, another positive thing is we have not declared we have a chief ministerial candidate. So that is not an impediment. There is no roadblock [for an alliance]. Anything can happen. But the answer could only be given by Mr. Vijayakant,” he stated.

Mr. Rao said the aim of the BJP was to unseat the two major Dravidian parties and provide a corruption free government to the people of Tamil Nadu.

In fact, Mr. Vijayakant’s declaration that he would go alone may also mean fighting the AIADMK and DMK. “In this, the two parties are on common ground,” he said.
title: It’s up to Vijayakant to decide, says BJP
